moves.1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5 3. exd5 Nf6 4. dxc6 Nx: Ok, let’s start the end game... on move 7.
moves.7... Qxd1+ 8. Kxd1 O-O-O+ 9. Bd2 Ne4: When you pin a piece, attack it again.
moves.10. Ke1 Bc5 11. f3 Ng3 12. Rh2: Leaves the knight and rook hanging.
moves.12... Bxg1 13. Bb5 Bxh2 14. Bf4 h6: Looking to play g5 soon and kick the bishop
moves.16... Bxg3+ 17. Kd1 Bf4: Pinned pieces should be attacked again.
moves.18. Bxc6: I need to take this bishop back, but I have time to harvest the d2 knight
Leaves the a1 rook vulnerable to a skewer
moves.21... Rg1+ 22. Kf2 Rxa1 23. a5: The queenside pawns will never queen (king and two pawns are there guarding), but lets clear some space for my rooks to mate.
moves.23... Bd2 24. Ke2 Bxc3 25. Ke3 Bxe5: Build a wall that the white king can’t cross
moves.26. Ke2 Rd8 27. Kf2 Ra3: Trap king on the 1st and 2nd ranks
moves.30. Ke1 Bg3+: Forces king away from defense of d1.
